etymologies: late Middle English. From Anglo-Norman rondelet, rundelete, probably from rondel + -et

definitions: A cask or vessel of varying capacity; (also) the quantity of liquid contained in this, often used as a measure for wine or spirits.

notes.text: Large rundlets appear usually to have varied between 15 and 18½ gallons (approx. 68 to 84 litres), small ones between a pint and 6 gallons (approx. 0.6 to 27 litres).
